questions.question: The author observes that
options: war, pestilence and famine were caused by the extravagance of nature
there was a time when uncontrolled birth made sense
It was wise at a time when mankind did not interfere with normal reproduction
nature was heartless in its reproductive process
questions.explanation: The passage suggests uncontrolled birth made sense when nature decimated the population.

questions.question: Which of these statements does not express the opinion of the author?
options: Mankind has started to interfere with the work of nature
Many people had died in the past through want and disease
Mankind should not have the maximum number of children possible
Mankind should take care of its children
Man's present relationship with nature in matters of birth and death is a happy one.
questions.explanation: The author implies the relationship is problematic.
